refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Functions for fetching mathematics layout data from OpenType fonts.
HarfBuzz itself does not implement a math layout solution. The functions and types provided can be used by client programs to access the font data necessary for typesetting OpenType Math layout.

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_has_data ()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a face has a MATH table.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if the table is found, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_constant ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the specified math constant. For most constants, the value returned is an hb_position_t.

However, if the requested constant is HB_OT_MATH_CONSTANT_SCRIPT_PERCENT_SCALE_DOWN, HB_OT_MATH_CONSTANT_SCRIPT_SCRIPT_PERCENT_SCALE_DOWN or HB_OT_MATH_CONSTANT_RADICAL_DEGREE_BOTTOM_RAISE_PERCENT, then the return value is an integer between 0 and 100 representing that percentage.
Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_italics_correction ()
refsect2.para: Fetches an italics-correction value (if one exists) for the specified glyph index.

entry.para: The glyph index from which to retrieve the value

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the italics correction of the glyph or zero

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_top_accent_attachment ()
refsect2.para: Fetches a top-accent-attachment value (if one exists) for the specified glyph index.

For any glyph that does not have a top-accent-attachment value - that is, a glyph not covered by the MathTopAccentAttachment table (or, when font has no MathTopAccentAttachment table or no MATH table, any glyph) - the function synthesizes a value, returning the position at one-half the glyph's advance width.

entry.para: The glyph index from which to retrieve the value

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the top accent attachment of the glyph or 0.5 * the advance width of glyph

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_kerning ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_position_t hb_ot_math_get_glyph_kerning (hb_font_t *font, hb_codepoint_t glyph, hb_ot_math_kern_t kern, hb_position_t correction_height);
refsect2.para: Fetches the math kerning (cut-ins) value for the specified font, glyph index, and kern .

If the MathKern table is found, the function examines it to find a height value that is greater or equal to correction_height . If such a height value is found, corresponding kerning value from the table is returned. If no such height value is found, the last kerning value is returned.

entry.para: The glyph index from which to retrieve the value
The hb_ot_math_kern_t from which to retrieve the value
the correction height to use to determine the kerning.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_kernings ()
refsect2.programlisting: unsigned int hb_ot_math_get_glyph_kernings (hb_font_t *font, hb_codepoint_t glyph, hb_ot_math_kern_t kern, unsigned int start_offset, unsigned int *entries_count, hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t *kern_entries);
refsect2.para: Fetches the raw MathKern (cut-in) data for the specified font, glyph index, and kern . The corresponding list of kern values and correction heights is returned as a list of hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t structs.
See also hb_ot_math_get_glyph_kerning, which handles selecting the appropriate kern value for a given correction height.
refsect2.note: For a glyph with n defined kern values (where n > 0), there are only nâˆ’1 defined correction heights, as each correction height defines a boundary past which the next kern value should be selected. Therefore, only the hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t.kern_value of the uppermost hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t actually comes from the font; its corresponding hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t.max_correction_height is always set to INT32_MAX.

entry.para: The glyph index from which to retrieve the kernings
The hb_ot_math_kern_t from which to retrieve the kernings
offset of the first kern entry to retrieve
Input = the maximum number of kern entries to return; Output = the actual number of kern entries returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the total number of kern values available or zero

refsect2.para: Since: 3.4.0

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_is_glyph_extended_shape ()
refsect2.para: Tests whether the given glyph index is an extended shape in the face.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if the glyph is an extended shape, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_variants ()
refsect2.programlisting: unsigned int hb_ot_math_get_glyph_variants (hb_font_t *font, hb_codepoint_t glyph, hb_direction_t direction, unsigned int start_offset, unsigned int *variants_count, hb_ot_math_glyph_variant_t *variants);
refsect2.para: Fetches the MathGlyphConstruction for the specified font, glyph index, and direction. The corresponding list of size variants is returned as a list of hb_ot_math_glyph_variant_t structs.
refsect2.note: The direction parameter is only used to select between horizontal or vertical directions for the construction. Even though all hb_direction_t values are accepted, only the result of HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL is considered.

entry.para: The index of the glyph to stretch
The direction of the stretching (horizontal or vertical)
offset of the first variant to retrieve
Input = the maximum number of variants to return; Output = the actual number of variants returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the total number of size variants available or zero

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_min_connector_overlap ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the MathVariants table for the specified font and returns the minimum overlap of connecting glyphs that are required to draw a glyph assembly in the specified direction.
refsect2.note: The direction parameter is only used to select between horizontal or vertical directions for the construction. Even though all hb_direction_t values are accepted, only the result of HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL is considered.

entry.para: direction of the stretching (horizontal or vertical)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: requested minimum connector overlap or zero

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_get_glyph_assembly ()
refsect2.programlisting: unsigned int hb_ot_math_get_glyph_assembly (hb_font_t *font, hb_codepoint_t glyph, hb_direction_t direction, unsigned int start_offset, unsigned int *parts_count, hb_ot_math_glyph_part_t *parts, hb_position_t *italics_correction);
refsect2.para: Fetches the GlyphAssembly for the specified font, glyph index, and direction. Returned are a list of hb_ot_math_glyph_part_t glyph parts that can be used to draw the glyph and an italics-correction value (if one is defined in the font).
refsect2.note: The direction parameter is only used to select between horizontal or vertical directions for the construction. Even though all hb_direction_t values are accepted, only the result of HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL is considered.

entry.para: The index of the glyph to stretch
direction of the stretching (horizontal or vertical)
offset of the first glyph part to retrieve
Input = maximum number of glyph parts to return; Output = actual number of parts returned.
italics correction of the glyph assembly.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the total number of parts in the glyph assembly

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: HB_OT_TAG_MATH
refsect2.para: OpenType Mathematical Typesetting Table.
Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: HB_OT_TAG_MATH_SCRIPT
refsect2.para: OpenType script tag, math, for features specific to math shaping.
refsect2.note: HB_OT_TAG_MATH_SCRIPT is not a valid hb_script_t and should only be used with functions that accept raw OpenType script tags, such as hb_ot_layout_collect_features. In other cases, HB_SCRIPT_MATH should be used instead.
refsect2.para: Since: 3.4.0

refsect2.title: enum hb_ot_math_constant_t
refsect2.para: The 'MATH' table constants, refer to OpenType documentation For more explanations.
Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: enum hb_ot_math_kern_t
refsect2.para: The math kerning-table types defined for the four corners of a glyph.

entry.para: The top right corner of the glyph.
The top left corner of the glyph.
The bottom right corner of the glyph.
The bottom left corner of the glyph.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_kern_entry_t
refsect2.para: Data type to hold math kerning (cut-in) information for a glyph.

entry.para: The maximum height at which this entry should be used
The kern value of the entry

refsect2.para: Since: 3.4.0

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_glyph_variant_t
refsect2.para: Data type to hold math-variant information for a glyph.

entry.para: The glyph index of the variant
The advance width of the variant

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: enum hb_ot_math_glyph_part_flags_t
refsect2.para: Flags for math glyph parts.

entry.para: This is an extender glyph part that can be repeated to reach the desired length.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3

refsect2.title: hb_ot_math_glyph_part_t
refsect2.para: Data type to hold information for a "part" component of a math-variant glyph. Large variants for stretchable math glyphs (such as parentheses) can be constructed on the fly from parts.

entry.para: The glyph index of the variant part
The length of the connector on the starting side of the variant part
The length of the connector on the ending side of the variant part
The total advance of the part

refsect2.para: Since: 1.3.3
